item.title:
RT by @ZoharAtkins: We Protestants can struggle with entering the great conversation because we too easily view it as a question of authority.
One can enter into the great conversation with Aristotle or Calvin without them an authority on all things.
item.dc:creator: @Ahimsa_Satya_
item.description:
We Protestants can struggle with entering the great conversation because we too easily view it as a question of authority.

One can enter into the great conversation with Aristotle or Calvin without them an authority on all things.

item.title: RT by @ZoharAtkins: Make conversation great again
item.dc:creator: @DoctorLockwood

item.title:
“…God said let there be light” (Genesis 1:1)
The rest is commentary, now go and learn it.

item.title:
I think I grow tensions like flowers in a wood where nobody goes.
- Robert Creeley

item.title: Archilochus: I hide therefore I am Augustine: I love therefore I am Descartes: I think therefore I am Dostoevsky: I suffer therefore I am Munger: I am therefore I always invert.
item.dc:creator: @ZoharAtkins
item.description:
Archilochus: I hide therefore I am
Augustine: I love therefore I am
Descartes: I think therefore I am
Dostoevsky: I suffer therefore I am
Munger: I am therefore I always invert.

nitter.privacydev.net/DylanoA4/status/1878529517649531300#m

item.title: All Trees of Life are Great Books but not all Great Books are Trees of Life.
item.dc:creator: @ZoharAtkins
item.description: All Trees of Life are Great Books but not all Great Books are Trees of Life.

item.title:
Why do we mourn the translation of Torah into Greek today, on 10th of Tevet?
Not because translation is bad, not because Greek translation is bad, but because the reduction of Torah to philosophy is a misunderstanding of Torah. Torah isn’t a treatise; it’s a tree of life.
item.dc:creator: @ZoharAtkins
item.description:
Why do we mourn the translation of Torah into Greek today, on 10th of Tevet?

Not because translation is bad, not because Greek translation is bad, but because the reduction of Torah to philosophy is a misunderstanding of Torah. Torah isn’t a treatise; it’s a tree of life.

item.title: Super intelligence is great but have you tried listening to a [divine] voice cooing like a dove, and murmuring “woe is me,” in an ancient ruin of Jerusalem?
item.dc:creator: @ZoharAtkins
item.description:
Super intelligence is great but have you tried listening to a [divine] voice cooing like a dove, and murmuring “woe is me,” in an ancient ruin of Jerusalem?

nitter.privacydev.net/tsarnick/status/1876822678343987251#m

item.title: Genesis is about fraternal enmity and strife. Moses and Aaron represent the first brotherly partnership. I don’t see anything cynical in that. Moses and Aaron share leadership, because the logic of Exodus demands it as a corrective to the strife of Joseph and his brothers (which was the catalyst for Israelite enslavement.) Zero-sum got the people into this mess. Only Positive-sum will get them out of it.
item.dc:creator: @ZoharAtkins
item.description:

Zero-sum got the people into this mess. Only Positive-sum will get them out of it.

item.title: “Everything in the hands of heaven but fear of heaven” means God can give you everything except conviction. Conviction is what you give to God.
item.dc:creator: @ZoharAtkins
item.description: “Everything in the hands of heaven but fear of heaven” means God can give you everything except conviction. Conviction is what you give to God.

item.title: R to @ZoharAtkins: Alternatively, we're not talking about fonts, but "wearables." The King would rock a nano-Torah like a boss.

item.title: Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi was really into fonts. Exile means no more Baskerville. You have to write in Times New Roman.
item.dc:creator: @ZoharAtkins
item.description: Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi was really into fonts. Exile means no more Baskerville. You have to write in Times New Roman.
